meanings.definition: The quality of being changeable or inconsistent.
meanings.sent1: Her ficklenesses in decision-making often led to confusion.
meanings.sent2: I couldn't rely on his ficklenesses when it came to keeping promises.
meanings.sent3: The ficklenesses of the weather made planning a picnic quite challenging.
meanings.sent4: The ficklenesses of the stock market can be compared to a rollercoaster ride.
meanings.sent5: The ficklenesses of a cat's mood can change in an instant.

meanings.definition: The state of being unreliable or untrustworthy.
meanings.sent1: His ficklenesses in business dealings made others hesitant to work with him.
meanings.sent2: The ficklenesses of the old car made it a risky purchase.
meanings.sent3: The ficklenesses of the alarm clock caused him to oversleep.
meanings.sent4: The ficklenesses of the compass left them lost in the woods.
meanings.sent5: The ficklenesses of the internet connection made online meetings difficult to conduct.
